revised_title: Deep-Sea Engineering: Manned and Remotely Controlled Vehicles
tldr: This article discusses the engineering aspects of manned and remotely controlled vehicles for deep-sea operations. It explores the current status and capabilities of these vehicles, including their design, depth capabilities, and work requirements. The authors predict future challenges and potential solutions for deep-sea engineering, emphasizing the importance of direct viewing, manipulative dexterity, and diver lockout support.
